work.summary: Internal generic search infrastructure for Google products
highlights: Designed novel approach to crowding, which increases search result diversity.
Implemented resource usage instrumentation, with monitoring/dashboards for team and clients.
Enabled clients such as YouTube to generate training data in real time, rather than using day-old stale data.
Implemented failover for features unsupported by storage backends, reducing leaky abstraction.

work.summary: Google Fiber builds its own WiFi routers and WiFi-capable set top boxes.  My team was responsible for WiFi functionality and performance.
highlights: Implemented bandsteering, 'encouraging' 5 GHz-capabable devices not to use 2.4 GHz.  Decreased WiFi-related customer support call minutes by 15% and improved throughput by up to 50% (depending on client device type).
Led project enabling set top boxes to use WiFi rather than ethernet/coax for backhaul, making user self-install possible and saving hundreds of dollars per customer.
Led team to build secure public guest networks using a cloud-based TOS captive portal.  This was crucial to our competitiveness in signing contracts with apartment buildings.
Executed platform bringup for Quantenna QSR1000 WiFi chipset, which was the foundation of the newest generation of Fiber devices.

Managed Fiber's relationship with a team of contractors working on mesh topology optimization - wrote specs and integration designs, collaborated with contractors on test plans, hosted biweekly status meetings, etc.

work.summary: Google Maps has a wide variety of data challenges.  I applied machine learning and crowdsourcing to solving some of these problems, while also building related infrastructure.
highlights: Tech lead for a team focused on optimizing internal crowdsourcing for changes to local data.
Designed and led implementation of the API for all user annotations on Maps (stars, reviews, etc.), which now serves several million requests per day.

Designed and implemented a Bayesian smoothing algorithm for place ratings, lowering the minimum review threshold for showing aggregate scores from ten reviews to five while also satisfying new product requirements.
Improved quality scoring of reviews enough to be able to sort reviews by quality by default, rather than by date.
Made local review spam filtering more effective, and improved spam infrastructure for many types of user content across Google.

work.summary: Track.com is a subscription-based independent financial research platform.  It was sold to FX Concepts in December of 2012.
highlights: Developed and iterated on core business concept.
Managed contractors and interns to build core software platform.
Responsible for all devops (deployment, server configuration, backups, failover)
Wrote a proprietary Flash-free cross-platform (IE6-compatible!) charting library (many exist now, but did not when I wrote it in 2010): https://rofrankel.github.io/sai/docs/
Wrote a conference calling system that was integrated tightly with our web platform, automatically authenticating and routing callers by event registration and phone number.

work.summary: NASA's Advanced Control and Evolvable Systems group is focused on biologically-inspired design and optimization techniques.
highlights: Integrated genetic algorithm with physical simulation software.  This was used to design an emitter for a minimized Scanning Electron Microscope for the Mars Rover.

work.summary: The Office web apps (now Office 365) are web-based implementations of the Office suite.
highlights: Developed two-page reading view for Microsoft Word web app.

work.summary: The Post Execution Trading System team is responsible for logging and auditing executed trades.
highlights: Developed an extensible auditing framework for production PETS environments.

work.summary: The Verification team is responsible for validating the correctness of new chip designs.
highlights: Implemented verification testing for Bulldozer processor core.

work.summary: Quigo Technologies was an advertising startup competing with Google's AdSense.  It was acquired by AOL in 2007.
highlights: Created advertising mockups for prospective customers.
Replaced myself with a web app that allowed non-technical sales and customer support staff to generate mockups for prospective customers.

publications.name: Assisted Highway Lane Changing with RASCL
publications.summary: Guidance system for human drivers of sensor-equipped cars.  LED- and sound-based alerts before dangerous lane changes, and speed change recommendations for safer lane changes given positions and velocities of nearby cars.  Many similar systems have since come to market.
